title: 199 upvotes problem
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\large \\dfrac{1}{a^{2}+9} + \\dfrac{1}{b^{2}+9} + \\dfrac{1}{c^{2}+9} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Given that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a,b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are positive reals with a sum of 1. If the maximum value of the above expression can be expressed as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\dfrac{x}{y}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are coprime integers, find the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x+y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

replies.body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Priyanshu Mishra – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" It should be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{1}{a}+\dfrac{1}{b}+\dfrac{1}{c} \ge 9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" not "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\le"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Priyanshu Mishra – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" I'm no expert and no fan of "AM-GM"... I don't think I have ever used the technique in my life. As you know, AM-GM is a special case of Jensen's inequality anyway. "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Otto Bretscher – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" OK. So, there do not exist AM-GM method to solve this problem? "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Priyanshu Mishra – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" Svatejas points out one mistake in your work. Also, showing that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{3}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is an upper bound does not show that it is the maximum... the value is not attained. "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Priyanshu Mishra – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" It s absolutely right as I see here. The am hm method is fine and 5 is a suitable answer "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Sir, is this not correct?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"By AM-GM"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ a }^{ 2 }+9\ge 6a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large\ \frac { 1 }{ { a }^{ 2 }+9 } \le \frac { 1 }{ 6a }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Similarly, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large\ \frac { 1 }{ b^{ 2 }+9 } \le \frac { 1 }{ 6b }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  and "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large\ \frac { 1 }{ c^{ 2 }+9 } \le \frac { 1 }{ 6c }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Adding them yields"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large\ \frac { 1 }{ a^{ 2 }+9 } +\frac { 1 }{ b^{ 2 }+9 } +\frac { 1 }{ c^{ 2 }+9 } \le \frac { 1 }{ 6a } +\frac { 1 }{ 6b } +\frac { 1 }{ 6c }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The  R.H.S  is equivalent to "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large\ \frac { 1 }{ 6 } \left( \frac { 1 }{ a } +\frac { 1 }{ b } +\frac { 1 }{ c }  \right)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And by  AM-HM"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large\ \frac { a+b+c }{ 3 } \ge \frac { 3 }{ \frac { 1 }{ a } +\frac { 1 }{ b } +\frac { 1 }{ c }  }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"i.e,  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large\ \frac { 1 }{ a } +\frac { 1 }{ b } +\frac { 1 }{ c } \le \frac { 9 }{ a+b+c } =9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence,  the expression given in the question  is  less than or equal to  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large\ \frac { 9 }{ 6 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large\ \frac { 3 }{ 2 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x + y = 3 + 2 = \boxed{5}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I know that  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  is not the answer , but sir please tell me where am i wrong?

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Akshay Sharma – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" You want the partial derivatives of the objective function "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to be proportional to the partial derivatives of the constraint "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"g=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", meaning that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f_a=\lambda g_a, f_b=\lambda g_b, f_c=\lambda g_c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for some "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\lambda"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". In this case we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"g_a=g_b=g_c=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so that the partial derivatives of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are required to be equal. "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Otto Bretscher – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" how and when to use lagrange multiplier please explain in detail and what are its conditions "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Aditya Kumar – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" With this simple example, I just wanted to show you that the solution isn't always "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=b=c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" when the equations are symmetric."}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sure, you can solve these problems with calculus... Lagrange multipliers are a powerful tool. "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Sir, in those kind of problems, I take x=y=0 z=1. That has also worked. I feel all these relations can be proved using calculus.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            The extrema are often attained when the variables are equal, but not always. You can't count on it, and you still have to examine each case separately. I will post a "},{"type":"text","text":"simple problem","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" to illustrate this point.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            This is because of equality condition in AM>=GM

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Sir, I've a doubt. I've solved many inequalities on brilliant using symmetry. Y does it work all the time? In this question I took symmetry for a,b,c. I got the idea for symmetry by inspiring from calculus. E.g. for a given perimeter of a triangle, the minimum area is that of an equilateral triangle. That's y I use a=b=c in inequalities. Is there a theoretical proof for this?

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

replies.body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Otto Bretscher – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" Yeah I also love Cauchy-Schwarz. "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Kushagra Sahni – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" In 40 years of experience in math (as a student, teacher, author, and researcher), I have never used an AM-GM-HM type of inequality, and I have never seen a mathematician use those (in seminar talks and such). The most widely used inequality is Cauchy-Schwarz, with Hoelder and Jensen being used occasionally. "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Mathematicians usually use Lagrange multipliers or other calculus techniques to solve constraint optimization problems. "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Which According to you are best inequalities?

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Maybe you can... I'm not very fond of these AM-GM-HM type of inequalities. They seem too limited in scope, and their application almost always seems forced and contrived.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            I think the most important technique in constrained optimization is Lagrange multipliers... there is a good lecture online from "},{"type":"text","text":"MIT","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" . Mathematicians rarely use inequalities in this context... if so, mostly Cauchy-Schwarz and perhaps Jensen's.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            In reponse to Otto Brestscher-Sir I want to know more about inequalities in calculus...can you suggest me some references or papers..I am a beginner in calculus and I am loving this subject..a direction is needed..hope u can help

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":"@Otto Bretscher"}],"attrs":[{"profile":"https://brilliant.org/profile/otto-jxcphj/"}]},{"type":"text","text":" u have only shown that the maximum value the given expression can obtain when "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0 \le a,b,c \le \sqrt{3}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{27}{82}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Do you have a proof that an yet bigger value cannot be achieved for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{3} \le a,b,c \le 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"?

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

replies.body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Dev Sharma – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" so show us how you find that max. "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Otto Bretscher – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" The problem asks to find max? "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Dev Sharma – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" But how does that help with our problem? I think it doesn't... (by the way, Titu's lemma is not a generalization of Cauchy Schwarz, but a very very special case) "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Otto Bretscher – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" yes, my first step is by Titu's Lemma, which is a generalization of Cauchy Scharwz "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Dev Sharma – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" Forgive me for being a bit slow, but I don't see where this is going, at all. You promised us a direct application of Titu's lemma ;) Can you spell it out for us? "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            it would be (1 + 1 + 1)^3 / (a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + 27)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"now the value of a^2 + b^2 + c^2 can be easily get by QM AM."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Putting values we got it!!

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            I don't think so....show us!

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

title: 19 ِAgain! - overlapped squares

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The following table gives the number of times an LED is toggled. If this number is even, then the LED will of OFF at the end, but if the number is odd, then the LED will be ON."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \begin{array}{cccccccccccccc}
1&2&3&4&5&5&5&\cdots&5&5&5&4&3&2&1 \\
2&4&6&8&10&10&10&\cdots&10&10&10&8&6&4&2 \\
3&6&9&12&15&15&15&\cdots&15&15&15&12&9&6&3 \\
4&8&12&16&20&20&20&\cdots&20&20&20&16&12&8&4 \\
5&10&15&20&25&25&25&\cdots&25&25&25&20&15&10&5 \\
5&10&15&20&25&25&25&\cdots&25&25&25&20&15&10&5 \\
5&10&15&20&25&25&25&\cdots&25&25&25&20&15&10&5 \\
\vdots&\vdots&\vdots&\vdots&\vdots&\vdots&\vdots&\ddots&\vdots&\vdots&\vdots&\vdots&\vdots&\vdots&\vdots& \\
5&10&15&20&25&25&25&\cdots&25&25&25&20&15&10&5 \\
5&10&15&20&25&25&25&\cdots&25&25&25&20&15&10&5 \\
5&10&15&20&25&25&25&\cdots&25&25&25&20&15&10&5 \\
4&8&12&16&20&20&20&\cdots&20&20&20&16&12&8&4 \\
3&6&9&12&15&15&15&\cdots&15&15&15&12&9&6&3 \\
2&4&6&8&10&10&10&\cdots&10&10&10&8&6&4&2 \\
1&2&3&4&5&5&5&\cdots&5&5&5&4&3&2&1
\end{array} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In the table, we see that there are 9 odd numbers in each of the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 5 \times 5 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"-corner squares. Additionally, in the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 5 \times 9 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"-edge rectangles, there are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 3 \cdot 9 = 27 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" odd numbers each. In the central "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 9 \times 9 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"-square, all 81 numbers are 25, so also odd."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, there are a total of"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 4 \cdot 9 + 4 \cdot 27 + 81 = \boxed{\boxed{225}} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"LEDs that will be on."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"How I got the table:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If we enumerate the LEDs such that the top left ist "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (1,1) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and the bottom right is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (19,19) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then the numbers in the top left quarter of the table are given by"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a_{(x,y)} = \min(x,5) \cdot \min(y,5) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is because for a particular LED "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (x,y) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" there is a toggling square for each LED that is to the top and left of this LED, but no further than 5 spots away."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A more complicated formula can also give the number for all LEDs"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a_{(x,y)} = \min(5, 10-|x-10|) \cdot \min(5, 10-|x-10|) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A general mathematical formula for any given "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" L \times W "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" grid taking   "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" n \times m "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" arrays"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Number  of  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \color{#D61F06} ON "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  LEDs "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"  =   L \times W -(\lfloor \frac{n}{2}\rfloor \times  2 \times W+\lfloor \frac{m}{2} \rfloor  \times 2 \times L) + \lfloor \frac{n}{2}\rfloor \times  \lfloor \frac{m}{2}\rfloor \times  4 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 19 and 97 are primes right?
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find "},{"type":"text","text":"positive integers","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x,y,z"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" satisfying "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x<y<z"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\dfrac{1}{x}-\\dfrac{1}{xy}-\\dfrac{1}{xyz}=\\dfrac{19}{97}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".                                                                           "}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Submit your answer as the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x+y+z"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The equation is equivalent to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"19xyz=97(yz-z-1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"19xyz+97=97z\times (y-1)."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"19"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"97"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are primes and so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"97"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" should divide one of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x,y,z."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Also "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"z"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" should divide "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"97"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" which means that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"z=97"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is prime. "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
From this it follows that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" divides "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"98=2\times 49=2\times 7^2;y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" being less than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"z=97."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The possibilities are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y=2,y=7,y=14,y=49."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y=2,19\times 2\times x=2\times 97-98=96"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" so that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is not an integer. "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y=7,19x=83"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" so that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is not an integer. "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y=14,19x=90"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" so that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is not an integer. "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y=49,19\times 49x=49\times 97-98. i.e.,x=5."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
Thus "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=5,y=49,z=97."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
Therefore "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x+y+z=5+49+97=\boxed{151}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
